War crimes in Ukraine: Police close investigation into murders in a street in Bucha
subhed: Ukrainian police have issued wanted notices for six Russian soldiers over the premeditated murder of 17 civilians in Bucha, a suburb of Kyiv, in 2022. In total, 378 bodies were found in the city.

title: 40 million Americans face food stamp disruption amid shutdown
subhed: Today, around one in eight Americans receives Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits each month based on income, according to the Department of Agriculture. In the event of non-payment, states have invited recipients to make use of food banks, which could be swiftly overwhelmed by the demand.

title: French lawmakers vote against wealth tax on super-rich
subhed: The proposal would impose a 2% tax on wealth over €100 million, which garnered a lot of popular support. It was proposed by economist Gabriel Zucman as a tool to help France balance its books.

title: Beware of food poisoning from Halloween pumpkins
subhed: Every year, dozens of people in France suffer mainly digestive symptoms after eating inedible squash. The biochemical origins of this plant toxicity are now better understood.

title: The French cities utterly transformed by Airbnb
subhed: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (3/6). Turning an apartment into short-term tourist accommodation may seem harmless. But on a large scale, it ends up transforming entire cities and daily life for their residents. France's politicians are trying to crack down on the system.

Egypt opens Grand Egyptian Museum, centerpiece of its tourism industry
byline: By Eliott Brachet (Cairo (Egypt) correspondent) and Samuel Forey
subhed: The colossal project dates back to the 1990s. The huge site, next to the pyramids of Giza, is billed as the largest museum in the world dedicated to a single civilization. It opens on November 1 after years of delays.

title: Three exhibitions in Paris celebrate 100 years of Art Deco
subhed: To mark the centenary of the International Exhibition of Modern Decorative and Industrial Arts, three venues are showcasing a leading figure of the movement, the archives of a renowned trunk-maker and contemporary creations.

title: Jacques-Louis David, at home in the Louvre
subhed: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.
